page.title: 08ST.MUNGO'S CHURCH DEARHAM
page.content: Dearham church was built in 1130 a.d Examples of the original Norman architecture can be found in the main doorway and chancel windows.in 1882 the building was restored and extended by the addition of a side isle and chancel arch.georgian windows were replaced in early english style.the tower is a fourteenth century addition built for protection from the border raids.it has 3 rooms linked by a right hand spiral staircase.originally the bell was on top of the tower.The church was dedicated to ST Mungo in 1932,the original dedication having been lost. inside the church the font is probably a Roman origin though the carvings are Norman.the viking cross,Adam stone and Kenneth stone suggest a Saxon church may have stood on this site.several medieval coffin lids are on display.
